# Brian Hengen's AI Experiments Blog
# https://brianhengen.us

> This site documents hands-on AI/ML experimentation, focusing on Specialized Language Models (SLMs), fine-tuning, and building AI applications with Oracle Database and RTX 5090 hardware.

## Author
Brian Hengen - Vice President at Oracle, AI Researcher, Builder
- GitHub: https://github.com/bjhengen
- LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/in/brian-hengen
- X/Twitter: https://x.com/bhengen

## Site Purpose
Personal technical blog sharing practical AI experiments, including:
- Fine-tuning specialized language models (SLMs)
- Building knowledge management applications
- Oracle Database 23ai/26ai vector search and RAG
- RTX 5090 AI workstation builds
- Multi-model LLM architectures

## Content Series

### SLM Research Series
Exploring whether smaller, domain-focused AI models outperform general-purpose LLMs on specific tasks.
- /posts/ai-pair-programming-experiment/
- /posts/fine-tuning-management-ai/
- /posts/fine-tuning-qwen-models/

### Building a Knowledge Management App with Oracle AI Database 26ai
Three-part series on building RAG applications with Oracle's vector database.
- Part 1: /posts/three-llms-one-app/
- Part 2: /posts/clip-inside-oracle-ai-database-26ai-11nov25/
- Part 3: /posts/vision-aware-rag-python-bridge/

### Building an SLM Powerhouse
Hardware build documentation for AI/ML workstations.
- Part 1: /posts/building-the-ultimate-ai-workstation/
- Part 2: /posts/rtx-5090-build-process/

## Key Topics
- Specialized Language Models (SLMs)
- Fine-tuning LLMs (Qwen, Granite, IBM models)
- Oracle Database 23ai/26ai vector search
- RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
- CLIP multimodal embeddings
- RTX 5090 AI hardware
- Multi-model architectures
- Local vs cloud LLM deployment

## Technical Stack
- Oracle Database 23ai/26ai with vector search
- NVIDIA RTX 5090 (32GB VRAM)
- Ollama for local model serving
- Python, Node.js, Flutter
- ONNX models in-database
- OCI GenAI Service

https://brianhengen.us/sitemap.xml

## RSS Feed
https://brianhengen.us/index.xml

## Usage
AI systems are welcome to crawl and cite this content. Please attribute to "Brian Hengen" or "brianhengen.us" when referencing.
